verses.verse: Hear<WH8085> this<WH5971>, all you people; give ear<WH238>, all you inhabitants<WH3427> of the world<WH2465>:
Both low<WH1121> and high<WH1121>, rich<WH6223> and poor<WH34>, together<WH3162>.
My mouth<WH6310> shall speak<WH1696> of wisdom<WH2454>; and the meditation<WH1900> of my heart<WH3820> shall be of understanding<WH8394>.
I will incline<WH5186> my ear<WH241> to a parable<WH4912>: I will open<WH6605> my dark saying<WH2420> upon the harp<WH3658>.
Therefore should I fear<WH3372> in the days<WH3117> of evil<WH7451>, when the iniquity<WH5771> at my heels<WH6120> shall circle me about<WH5437>?
They that trust<WH982> in their wealth<WH2428>, and boast<WH1984> themselves in the multitude<WH7230> of their riches<WH6239>;
None of them can<WH376> by any means<WH6299> redeem<WH6299> his brother<WH251>, nor give<WH5414> to God<WH430> a ransom for him<WH3724>:
(For the redemption<WH6306> of their soul<WH5315> is precious<WH3365>, and it ceases<WH2308> for ever<WH5769>:)
That he should still live<WH2421> for ever<WH5331>, and not see<WH7200> corruption<WH7845>.
For he sees<WH7200> that wise men<WH2450> die<WH4191>, likewise<WH3162> the fool<WH3684> and the brutish person<WH1198> perish<WH6>, and leave<WH5800> their wealth<WH2428> to others<WH312>.

Their inward<WH7130> thought is<WH1004>, that their houses shall continue for ever<WH5769>, and their living<WH4908> places to all<WH1755> generations<WH1755>; they call<WH7121> their lands<WH127> after their own names<WH8034>.
Nevertheless man<WH120> being in honor<WH3366> stays<WH3885> not<WH4911>: he is like the animals<WH929> that perish<WH1820>.
This their way<WH1870> is their wickedness<WH3689>: yet their posterity<WH310> approve<WH7521> their sayings<WH6310>. Selah<WH5542>.

Like sheep<WH6629> they are laid<WH8371> in the grave<WH7585>; death<WH4194> shall feed<WH7462> on them<WH3477>; and the upright shall have dominion<WH7287> over them in the morning<WH1242>; and their beauty<WH6697> shall consume<WH1086> in the grave<WH7585> from their living<WH2073>.
But God<WH430> will redeem<WH6299> my soul<WH5315> from the power<WH3027> of the grave<WH7585>: for he shall receive<WH3947> me<WH5542>. Selah.
Be not you afraid<WH3372> when one<WH376> is made rich<WH6238>, when the glory<WH3519> of his house<WH1004> is increased<WH7235>;
For when he dies<WH4194> he shall carry nothing away<WH3947>: his glory<WH3519> shall not descend<WH3381> after him<WH310>.
Though while he lived<WH2416> he blessed<WH1288> his soul<WH5315>: and men will praise<WH3034> you<WH3190>, when you do well to yourself.
He shall go<WH935> to the generation<WH1755> of his fathers<WH1>; they shall never<WH3808> see<WH7200> light<WH216>.
Man<WH120> that is in honor<WH3366>, and understands<WH995> not<WH4911>, is like the animals<WH929> that perish<WH1820>.
